reviews.review_msg: Greg is an amazing professor. Looks like John Lennon. Although his lectures consist of him just talking (no PowerPoints), he teaches the material so eloquently that it's easy to understand. Lots of readings. Very caring and accessible outside of class. One of those eye-opening professors; very hilarious. Loves the Rolling Stones.
My favorite prof.

I took IS 101 and now 324.  He is the most amazing professor.  He knows so much and pushes you to expand your thinking.  Both awesome classes. You have to work hard and by that I mean do your readings and actually put in an effort.  So worth it!
Learning can be fun. Challenging - be prepared, but this is the stuff if you want to get something out of your studies.
Best class and best prof at SFU.
Fun, smart and demanding.
His accent is too strong which makes it hard to understand what he is trying to say. Quizzes are unfair and worth a large portion of your grade. Avoid this guy at all cost!

Clearly passionate about his subject. Good at conveying concepts and terms. Quiz/attendance component juvenile & overweighted in marks. Readings too long/dense for an intro course. Class policies sort of infuriating. Please don't take IS if you want a grade bump, you will not get it. Overall useful for arts/hum but super frustrating in practice.

This man may be the most boring individaul I have had the misfortune of listening to. He sounds like a monotone muppet. He is hard to understand, he is not clear about what he wants, he just re-reads what's written on his powerpoints. God help you if you have this guy.

Lectures were dry and uninformative. He mainly read off the slides. He seemed interested in the material, but was unable to convey it adequately. Readings were more confusing than helpful and rather lengthy.

I started off this course without any pre-conceived notions about the prof.After 1 semester I hv learned:Keep your ideas to yourself and write what the T.A/prof wants u 2.The course is 2 broad and readings 2 difficult.I feel like the main goal is to scare away people from pursuing IS further,if they can't think like the prof/TA.

The absolute killer is the readings. Too much for a first year crs. Must have some prior knowledge to survive. He did seem helpful but lectures were monotone and did not really reflect his personality. This is definitely not a walk in the park. Expect to SWEAT! Should try to involve studetns more during the lecture, or they'll just fall asleep.

Paper is v. restricted - wants you to write it in spec. way - more concerned with format than with ur critical thinking skills. Odd. I recommend tht anyone who takes his intro IS course also take ECON at same time -- this will help LOADS w the material he provides. Also, do the monstrous readings. They hurt, but they are ur key to survival.

Most frustrating aspect of class is his clear neoliberalist econ bias - he is diplomatic enough to inc other P.O.Vs in reading material, but his lecs are structured as arguments... which almost always return to one perspective. LOTS of reading. and unclear quiz schedule, one never knows just what will be tested. Still, he's fairly helpful.

Rude. Ppl did so bad on de essays worth 30% bcus of 2 reasons; 1.He didn't tell us wut to expect. (Aftr it was markd, he said, ur expectd to get de dfinitions from txt, my TA said dffrnt)2. TAs tink tis aint a 1st yr class & expect too much. Ta says he is so nice for final, ONLY 2 essays + etc, on final. my ta was a goody goody on his side.

He & his TAs were hard markers! I also never did so bad on a paper ever! I nvr gotten less than a B- in my writings at SFU. TREND?! Well, record broken, C- for me as well! I hated his pop quizzes! It was a harsh and tough semester. He was obviously not meant to teach. Bad choice, I wished he would just quit teaching, and move on to something else.

Worst class ever. Very mono-tone, reads right off the notes, I want to be an IS major, I worked my ass off... for what? a C- paper (I've never had anything lower than a B on papers), a confusing final, and tutorials that did absolutely nothing. Unless you want to major in IS, think twice before registering in IS when he is teaching it.

A bad, bad prof. Little to no interest in what he teaches, and extremely rude and condescending towards his students. I don't know who in the right mind would ever pay to be in his class. Before taking his class, I intended to major in IS. Now, I have my doubts. He made the course content completely unappealing in every way possible.
Yes, the course contents are extremely hard because they want people who really interested in IS to stay. The prof is fun. Although he always read his slides, and he got the weird Norwegian accent.

To who said tis was deir best prof in 3yrs, you must have had a lot of bad profs! I rate him the worst prof I have had! Too much difficult readings and too much expectations in pre-tutorial assignments! This is the hardest intro course, lectures are unhelpful, he reads rite off of the notes, with very lil explanations, leavin the majority CLUELESS

Worst & most difficult course I have ever taken in university. Essay was marked way too harsh, I never recieved anything worse than a B in my writings & ended up with a C-! Ask the TA for help? She sent me to SLC, which didn't help! Ask her for her email, she says "What for?" No one in my class has her email, if you got a question, just suck it up?
i would not take this course with him had i know first how horrible it was going to be. there is no MT so everything will be tested on a final worth 40%. take it with someone else!

Sure the lectures can be a bit dull at times, but I don't really think it's the prof's fault, mostly just the nature of the subject. He is a great teacher in that he knows a lot about his subject, he is straightforward with his teaching and is very passionate about international studies.
so hot
worst prof and worst class ever! stay away from this class and prof at all costs.
dunt take this course if you think it's an easy credit. 30% paper for a first year course is not FUN!he's not willing to help and the lecture is so boring..and his TA sucks too.

I totally disagree. I am a Political Science major and I've taken numerous classes on international relations. You do not get anything out of the lectures, since the prof just rambles on and on about Economic History. His TA's on the other hand, have no idea about Economics. Overall, the class is too hard for an intro level class.

The lecture drags on the entire two hours and I find it difficult to focus. The textbook used for this course is extremely diffifult to understand and is mind-numbing. The only positive aspect is the tutorial, which is surprisingly helpful and the discussions thought-provoking. I would not take this class unless you are intending on majoring in IS.
the readings are ridiculously long and often do not relate to the stuff covered in lecture. The lectures are boring and his TA's suck.

dr. moustafa is a nice prof but his midterm and final was outrageously so difficult and hard. nothing in the lecture really helps you prepare for the tests unless you have a really good background about IS and is actually interested. he reads off of his paper and doesn't really say much..... TA's were super nice though and were all willing to help

Very good professor for a first-year course. Very caring and helped guide students on how to succeed in university. Lectures were interesting and not boring, Professor Tamir made it enjoyable to attend class. Grading is very straightforward and the tests are easy if the readings are done. Would highly reccomend!

Tamir Moustafa is, by far, one of the best professors I've ever had. It's obvious he's very passionate about the subject, and cares a lot for the students. He inspired me to pursue political science. His lesson plans are full of amazing content. I also recommend buying some of his books-they're super interesting and full of great stuff.

Professor Moustafa is, by far, one of the best professors I've ever had. His lectures are inspirational, and it's obvious he cares for his students. Professor Moustafa inspired me to pursue a future in political science. I also highly recommend buying some of his published books-they are interesting and filled with valuable knowledge.

Extremely nice professor don't get me wrong but provides little to no information on the slides, does not record/let you record, provides little information for exams, and goes through lessons very quickly. Overall, he's passionate about his work and is very respectable, but needs some work on his teaching.

Super nice prof don't get me wrong
But he does not know how to teach. Half the time he is just rubbing his beard because he does not know what he is teaching. The TA also does not know how to teach because all she does it talk without explaining anything.
This was a really good course. I like how we focused on one "global issue" each week. I'm looking forward to more IS courses.

Confusion for 4 months straight. Read the textbook thoroughly? Won't matter because the mt is based on small facts from the 12pg long online readings. Want to know how you did on the major paper? Come to the van campus after the course ends. Want to know how you did on the final? Fat chance. Good thing they curved the grade or most would've failed

Really interesting class but the lectures were too long for the amount of info prof gave. Lectures mandatory, he doesn't post slides or audio. Pretty nice prof in general, was really chill about everything and approachable. Participation counts for 5% so get ready to talk during tutorials. Easy mt & final if you study lecture concepts well

No breaks in this lecture so the lecture may seem long. Sometime will end early tho. Prof is somewhat funny and entertain. Lecture notes were long and he doesnt give you too much time to copy it down. Pay attention in class, some key points arent in the lecture slides.  Most lecture slides were pictures and diagrams.

Dr. Moustafas lectures were interesting and often very compelling. The topics he selected for this course were well chosen as were the readings in the course reader. He was clear, concise, and often very helpful. I only wish sometimes he would have taken the time to explain topics in depth. Overall a nice, excellent professor. Highly recommend.

Very nice and easy going guy, who is  passionate about the subject. Unfortunately, he lacks confidence and is very disorganized. Notes aren't detailed enough and are not posted online. Gives good feedback and tutorials incorporate the textbook readings well. His exams are easy if you study. Would definitely take a class with him again!

Seems like a nice guy and is clearly interested in the material - but lectures are so boring-2hrs feels like 6, seems a little disorganized, says "UM" about a million times per class and the material isn't really that engaging. Doesn't post lecture notes. It's an easy class but I would NEVER have taken it if I knew what it was going to be like.

The Textbook is the most boring thing to read, and the lectures are not much better. He is not a good public speaker, the best quality about him is that he is really interested in the subject. I would not take it again. Majority of course revolves around development, human rights, povertyinequality and the environment
sometimes a little boring and seems a little unorganized at times. I really like the material and feel that he is a good prof. Tests are fairly easy if you study and prepare.

I thought he was great. It was an Intro class so it was pretty easy anyway. I'm not sure what higher level classes with him are like yet. He knows what he is talking about in this subject matter. However, sometimes he seems a little disorganized. I would still recommend him as a professor.

Such a great prof! His "no PowerPoint rule" really makes you focus in class which ultimately makes you understand it and feel more prepared. only prof who honestly understood and cared for you. Overall, I really didn't like IS 101 as the content (arts isn't for me and it was my 1st sem so I just took it) but he genuinely makes it engaging and funny

Gregory Feldman is an amazing prof but you need to show up to class because he speaks for 2 hours and has no powerpoint slides. Content was really good and if he's your tutorial instructor  than you'll get a better mark in class. Overall he's and inspirational teacher and Id definaltely  take a class with him again.

Very charismatic and inspiring lecturer. He really makes you think. No lecture slides though so you'll have to attend class and take detailed notes of what he says. Exams were based primarily off of the weekly readings.  Also, no textbook required, which my student budget appreciated! Great prof, would highly recommend

IS itself as a course is not something I would recommend unless its something you are interested/majoring in. It is basically a history course and feldman just talks for 2 hours. Definitely teaches you how to take notes,  no slides are provided. A lot of readings that are hard to comprehend. Tutorials have a presentation but its low maintenance.

Feldman is a smart guy. However this class was shamelessly biased towards a radical left-wing conception of IS. More like anthropology. If you're not critical, you will walk away believing that borders are racist constructions that shouldn't exist and America is a terrorist regime. Waste of time and money. Advisable to take with more balanced prof

Great prof with very interesting course content! My favourite class this semester. Readings are important (can be long and boring sometimes) for the two 500 word essays, midterm and final exam. Good discussions in class.

He is a fantastic prof! Lectures can be long, but his jokes and views really keep it going! Very intelligent man, taught me a lot of things that will be useful outside the classroom that I shall never forget! Make sure to do the readings! Even though they can be a bit dry. Wish I could've had his tutorial, I did not enjoy mine with the TA

If you can take a class with him, don't even hesitate. He made me think of things in ways that had never even occurred to me. Brilliant lectures and great readings. 10/10. There are no lecture slides though, so you have to attend, but he's fantastic so it's not even a chore.

Greg is charismatic and makes a lot of "dad jokes". He is useless with technology and yells at the IT dept when there is any problems; spends a lot of time trying to get the projector working. Very left-leaning politically and it comes out in his lectures. Just know the difference between opinions and facts. Very informative lectures otherwise.
awesome prof! inspirational! definitely recommend.

Best prof i have ever had. The lectures are informative and really interesting because you learn a lot about the world you live in. There is a reading every week and there are 2 discuasion papers and tutorials are mandatory. I highly recommend taking this class with him.
his lectures are SOOOOOOOO boring. Reading material just blows you off
Great guy, slow class.
Awesome Prof! Very inspiring. Take his classes! Clear, interesting lectures.

Course had great potential to be interesting, but Shawn kind of ruined it. His lectures were biased. Quizzes & term paper were fair if TAs marked it. Final was very irrelevant & focused on small, unnecessary details. His teaching style is scattered so it's hard to understand what he wants to say. Plus, his English isn't the best. Textbook=useless

The course is very interesting.The quizzes were fair (although one required us to know which were the correct news for the month) and the final exam was so EASY! The lecture slides and videos are all that is needed to ace the exam,the textbook is BORING and USELESS. I didn't like the paper marking and Shawn needs to work on his English!!

I'm a science student who took this class out of pure interest and I found Shawn to be one of the best profs I've ever had at SFU! His exam was extremely fair, I reviewed his lecture notes, quizzes,& youtube vids and got above average. He's extremely fair and nice you just need to keep up with the course by reviewing lectures b/c of the pop quizzes

Despite the negaive comments, as long as you read his lecture slides, you will do fine. Quizes & term paper were fair. The final was awkward but as long as you reviewed his slides, it was quite easy. Overall, nice guy and interesting course material.

So despite what many people have said it is possible to do well in this course. I know many people who got A's. But you do have to study! You cannot expect to do well in this course without working at it. It is true that he doesn't teach very well and most of the iformation is copied straight from the textbook. But the content is interesting!

His expectations: Talk loud and long every tut session for full participation marks, know the month of all (Yes, All, Quiz Question) reported news during the course, memorize a photo from early in the semester (Final question), and finally, be an expert at writing essays before taking this 100-level course. Good Luck.
Great Prof.Class was very interesting, and while the final was hard, it was adjusted. People overreacted. I would take his class again - no doubt about it.

Prof is useless. Can't teach, extremely bias. Final was irrelevant and marking extremely unfair. Don't expect to be rewarded for studying and knowing your stuff, he will still find a way to give you a low mark on the final exam. So many A students failed because of his lack of skills and fairness.

the 2 ratings below are biased, lies, and irrelevant. if the final is "fair" why is everyone near failing because of it? why is the board revising the marking schemes? how about printing a colored map in b/w? most of us spent sufficient time studying for this, so don't blame it all on us. your lies will affect future students. where's your heart?

Definitely not an easy course. You have to work hard, but it's possible to do well. The 'language barrier' is really not a big problem. The final was fair. If you studied it wasn't hard to get a good grade on it. Everything on the final was discussed in class.

The essay was marked to a really high standard and there could have been more preparation for it, but it was very possible to get a good mark on the final exam if you studied hard.  Everything on it was directly from what he talked about in class.  You definitely had to work for a good mark.

I am sure that deep down he is a nice person, & I was told it was his first year teaching... that being said he has the futures of 300 students in his hands, & we are all, for the most part, very unhappy. The final exam was rushed, both by Shen, & the students who wrote it and I think he should be required to take an English pronounciation class.

Text book was useless and a waste of money. Final was hard, unfair, and way too specific. Shawn is a good person, but can't teach at all. It's more useful to just put on headphones and read the slides. Also there are 2 ways to spell globalisation.

Very inexperienced and terrible. Includes his biased opinions into definitions of words, puts irrelevant material in quizzes, and the final didn't even test most of the stuff covered in the course! Instead of making us define globalization, he asked how many countries in the UN!! Students will get misled by what he teaches.

I found the course to be all over the place and it was hard to interconnect a lot of the information. Only thing was the prof. provided better slides than that ridiculous text book. Final exam was random and focuses on specifics that weren't emphasized in the course. Avoid this course with Shawn if you're an already anxiety plagued freshman.
This class has such interesting content, yet the teaching style made it so terrible. His final exam was WAYY TOO specific considering the course is so broad. Honestly, avoid his courses at any cost.

I would just like to say that this year's exam final average was 22.5/40. That's interesting, considering the averages for the pop quizzes and term paper were much higher.. Exam was not cummulative, rather it focused on specific areas- i.e if you didnt recognize one question, it was likely you'd miss the others also.

Prof is unclear in teaching style; a definite language barrier. Main concept of the course was Globalization and he spelled it incorrectly. Unfair marker, poor course layout. Current events were useless to the course, not to mention the final exam. Would not recommend taking this course, definitely brings down the GPA. Overall, a terrible prof.

For an introductory course to International Studies, the prof really failed to do his job. I would NEVER recommend taking this course if Shawn Shen is teaching it. He doesn't understand how to use a lapel mic, which makes it loud and extremely hard to hear. The content has the ability to be interesting but his lectures lack an overall focus.

Horrible teacher. The exam was ridiculous, the subjects covered and emphasized weren't tested, and he made it very hard to actually learn the concepts. Please, don't take this course. It would be a simple, fun course were it taught by anyone else. It isn't.

Shawn Shen's teaching style is confusing his tangents are entirely irrelevant. I felt like I was teaching myself the course spending majority of my time outside of lectures trying to decipher what he had intended to say that week in oppose to actually looking over the concepts.

At first i liked his laid back humor. In the end, his accent and his choice of words made it realy hard for me to follow what he is trying to say. His lectures can also be pretty biased, making the content a bit unclear. Pretty much just reads his lecture slides out to class. Some youtube videos to give some variety which was good.

Shawn is super cool! I was surprised he gave me higher final grades than what I should originally get for the class! The exam is so easy; everything that he already told us what's on the final in the review class. I cannot believe this! Oh he always gives free bonus marks to the students! What a easy course to boost my GPA!

Wow...Shawn can not teach at all...so far WORST PROF at SFU...does not know how to mark students, very unhelpful and rude in emails.Instead of boosting my GPA it bought it down ALOT...avoid him at all costs

Pop quiz is fairly easy as he always gives free marks or he likes to call them the bonus. one time he just asked us to write answers from watching a documentary film and automatically get full marks. He showed a lot of youtube that are very funny! I like that he always gives free marks!
Lectures were ok, it is hard for him to explain stuff clearly maybe cause english isn't his first language. Textbook was horrible. Final was easy. Essay wasn't too bad.
I hate the pop qiuz and the essay mark is too low. And too many local in this class, so the other international students rarely have chance to talk. Therefore, the paticipant marks are low....
No point in going to lectures since he just copies and pastes from the book onto his pp slides. He's pretty funny but not adequate for teaching.

For a 100 level class....Shawn makes it as hard as he possibly can. Awful teaching style, cannot explain concepts to students. and the pop quizzes, BRUTAL. I strongly recommend against taking this class. This is not an easy GPA booster....if anything, its going to bring your mark down.

Shawn is a good human being, but needs to improve teaching skills specifically breaking down the information from the book, instead of copying straight from it---> hard to understand. And explain more clearly the criteria for essay. favorite saying from him: "Clear, clear as mud?!" beware first year students!
Really needs to improve his charisma...
Onur is very friendly and helpful. He is passionate about what he teaches. I absolutely recommend taking a class with him!

I really don't know what these people are complaining about. He's not a bad lecturer, and he's a pretty damn fair/somewhat easy marker. I would recommend him. It sounds like some of these people rating him on this website never paid attention in classes and failed.

He's got a sense of humour, but that humour doesn't make up for his other faults. He is fairly quiet, and he doesn't use a mic, so sit at the front. Other problem I found was that he doesn't really emphasize important parts for midterms/tests. You have to read the extra readings, textbook, take notes, and listen carefully to get a decent mark.

English is his second language and it appears to be recently acquired. Over confident and arrogant. Withdrew from the class a month into the semester and never regretted it. I pay good money to learn at this school, and I did with M. Howard (boring but good.)

Onur is a very helpful prof. I suppose he is still new so a long way to go but it is clear that he is a very passionate prof. Just do the readings properly, read the notes and you will be fine. It is quite interesting and he always tries to get the students in on discussions and their points of view into the picture.

Onur is such a friendly guy and it is obvious that he is very interested in the material but he has a hard time getting the main ideas across. He throws so much information at you not emphasizing much so it is hard to know what to study. Exams were fair, just required lots of preparation. Pretty hard to understand. Easy to dose off in class.
I studied slides that he gave us, memorized everything word for word. When I saw the final, I felt like quitting the class. More than half of the final was not what he taught in class.

Pretty easy class as long as you do the readings and show up to lectures. He's hard to understand at times because he has an accent but it's not too bad. Midterms aren't too tough as long as you pay attention in class. He's a nice prof, pretty funny at times, and he's cute which is always a plus.
Lectures can be boring, although he attempts to make jokes now and again! Midterms are easy if you pay attention and study the notes. I would take another class with him!
terrible prof. DONT take his courses. Waste of time

Doesn't spoon-feed you answers or study guides, but won't throw you curve balls & intentionally make hard midterms/exams. Awesome if you get him for your tutorial as well, he's much more passionate than in lecture. A little dry, but I did have him for an intro course, he was probably bored. Also: super cute and turkish.

Excellent professor - qualified, passionate, and wants students to understand. It is a difficult course but an important subject and he expects students to develop an understanding of concepts outside the classroom which is not at all unreasonable. I would take a class with him again in a heartbeat.
Nothing terrible or great to say.

The pinnacle of a 'meh' prof. Lectures aren't all that interesting, neither are the readings she gives out. She'll often bring up background 'facts' and get dates wrong. If you've taken any history classes you'll be annoyed when she perpetuates misnomers of historical events

Megan is such an inspirational baddie feminist, scholar, and professor! We all love her. Her classes are engaging and she helps  She is a bit of a hard marker (very hard to get an A+), but she's also very fair and willing to re-mark if you request it. She offers students so many opportunities to support us in many ways. Her stories are also epic.

Megan is amazing. She is so sweet super approachable and genuinely cares about her students even in a class with 200 people. Marks quite hard on the briefing paper but quizzes are easy as long as you review lectures. A lot of reading but majority of them are quite interesting. Overall would definitely recommend any classes with her she is awesome.
